cinch.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: ‘How was the exam?’ ‘Oh, it was a cinch!’
The program is a cinch to install.
be a cinch to do something
cinch.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: something that will definitely happen, or someone who will definitely do something
cinch.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Most observers say the president is a cinch to win re-election.
be a cinch to do something
cinch.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to pull a belt, strap etc tightly around something
cinch.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a blue dress cinched at the waist by a wide belt
cinch.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to make something certain to happen
cinch.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: They cinched a place in the play-off.
